locale.name: en_US
locale.message: Have title appear under Editorial Team in People section of About the Press (e.g. Editor)
Have title appear as its own category under People (e.g. Editorial Board)
OMP lists people in Editorial Team under assigned roles (Press Manager, Copyeditor, etc.)
The Press Manager creates titles and adds people under each title.
No editorial team positions have been created.
This will replace any locale-specific press settings you had for this locale

OMP can be made available to users in any of several supported languages. As well, OMP can operate as a multilingual system, providing users with an ability to toggle between languages on each page, and allowing certain data to be entered in several additional languages.

If a language supported by OMP is not listed below, ask your site administrator to install the language from the site administration interface. For instructions on adding support for new languages, please consult the OMP documentation.
Sorry, no additional languages are available. Contact your site administrator if you wish to use additional languages with this press.
This will be the default language for the press site.

Plugin was not successfully copied. This may be a permissions problem. Please make sure that the web server is able to write to the plugins directory (including subdirectories) but don't forget to secure it again later.
Are you sure you wish to delete this plugin from the system?
By clicking delete, you will delete the plugin from the server's file system.

Plugin could not be deleted from the file system. This may be a permissions problem. Please make sure that the web server is able to write to the plugins directory (including subdirectories) but don't forget to secure it again later.

This page allows the Press Manager to review and potentially configure the plugins that are currently installed. Plugins are divided into categories, according to their function. The categories are listed below, and within each category, its current set of plugins.
This form allows you to upload and install a new plugin. Please ensure the plugin is compressed as a .tar.gz file.
Plugin already exists, and is newer or equal to installed version
Plugin already exists, and is older or equal to the installed version
The uploaded plugin archive does not contain a folder that corresponds to the plugin name.
The uploaded plugin does not fit the category of the upgraded plugin.
The version.xml in the uploaded plugin contains a plugin name that does not fit the name of the upgraded plugin.
Plugin does not exist. Please Install instead
Plugin already exists, but is newer than installed version. Please upgrade instead
The tar command is not available. Please correctly configure it in your "config.inc.php".
This form allows you to upgrade a plugin. Please ensure the plugin is compressed as a .tar.gz file.
version.xml in plugin directory contains invalid data.
version.xml not found in plugin directory
Confirm delete of a published review form...
Confirm delete of an upublished review form...
A title is required for the review form.

The peer review forms created here will be presented to reviewers to complete, instead of the default form which consists of two open text boxes, the first "for author and editor," and the second "for editor." Review forms can be designated for a specific press section, and editors will have the option to choose which form to use in assigning the review. In all cases, editors will have the option of including the reviews in corresponding with the author.
No review forms have been created.
No review forms have been used.
Checkboxes (you can choose one or more)
Confirm delete of a published form item...
An item type is required for the form item.
A question is required for the form item.
No form items have been created.
Radio buttons (you can only choose one)
Please ensure that at least one checkbox is checked for each Series Editor assignment.
Please ensure that you have chosen a valid review form.
Will not be included in the indexing of the press
Items can only be submitted by Editors and Series Editors.
Are you sure you want to permanently delete this series?
Disable reader comments for this series.

Add a Series Editor to this series from the available Series Editors. Once added, designate whether the Series Editor will oversee the REVIEW (peer review) and/or the EDITING (copyediting, layout and proofreading) of submissions to this series. Series Editors are created by clicking Series Editors under Roles in Press Management.
Omit this series from About the Press.
An abbreviated title is required for the series.
A title is required for the series.
All settings specific to the press (details, policies, workflow, look and feel).
All settings that allow for manipulation of data (file browser, reviewer database, reports, import/export, COUNTER stats).
All settings specific to the OMP system for this press (archiving, prepared emails, reading tools, languages, payments, plugins).
Enroll a User from this Site in this Press
Remove this user from this press? This action will unenroll the user from all roles within this press.

Select a user to merge into another user account (e.g., when someone has two user accounts). The account selected first will be deleted and its submissions, assignments, etc. will be attributed to the second account.
Select a user to whom to attribute the previous user's authorships, editing assignments, etc.

Enrollment synchronization will enroll all users enrolled in the specified role in the specified press into the same role in this press. This function allows a common set of users (e.g., Reviewers) to be synchronized between presses.

Disable this user? This will prevent the user from logging into the system.
You may optionally provide the user with a reason for disabling their account.

Sorry, you do not have administrative rights over this user. This may be because:
  • The user is a site administrator
  • The user is active in presses you do not manage
This task must be performed by a site administrator.
A library file is required. Please ensure that you have chosen and uploaded a file.
A name is required for this library file.
All settings related to access and security management for this press (manage users, manage roles, site access options).
You are about to remove this role from this press. This operation will also delete related settings and all the users assignments to this role. Do you want to continue?
You need to define a role name.
You need to define a role abbreviature.
You need to define an unique role name.
You need to define an unique role abbreviature.
You need to define a role permission level.
Are you sure you want to reset all email templates in this press? You will lose any customizations you have made.
Add Item to Appear in "About the Press"
Add the following content, using text/HTML, which will appear below the homepage image, if one is uploaded.
Alternately, instead of title and logo, an HTML version of the header can be inserted into the text box below. Leave textbox blank if not required.
Announcements may be published to inform readers of press news and events. Published announcements will appear on the Announcements page.
Enter any additional information that should be displayed to readers on the Announcements page.
Require authors to agree to Copyright Notice as part of the submission process.

The Copyright Notice entered below will appear in About the Press and in each published item's metadata. While it is up to the press to determine the nature of its copyright agreement with authors, the Public Knowledge Project recommends the use of the Creative Commons license. To that end, it provides sample Copyright Notice wording that can be cut and pasted into the space below for presses that (a) offer open access, (b) offer delayed open access, or (c) do not offer open access.

Set out for authors the bibliographic and formatting standards used for items submitted to the press (e.g., Publication Manual of the American Psychological Association, 5th edition, 2001). It is often helpful to provide examples of the common citation formats for presses and books to be used in submissions.
Additional agencies or organizations that provide financial or in-kind support for the press will appear in About the Press and may be accompanied by a note of acknowledgement.

The Copyedit Instructions will be made available to Copyeditors, Authors, and Section Editors in the Submission Editing stage. Below is a default set of instructions in HTML, which can be modified or replaced by the Press Manager at any point (in HTML or plain text).
(E.g., European Renaissance; Jurassic Period; Third Trimester; etc.)
Provide examples of relevant chronological or historical terms for this field
Refers to geo-spatial location, chronological or historical coverage, and/or characteristics of research sample.
(E.g., Iberian Peninsula; Stratosphere; Boreal Forest; etc.)
Provide examples of relevant geo-spatial or geographical terms for this field
Provide examples of research sample characteristics for this field
Number of Recent Items on Homepage
Custom HTML header tags to be inserted in the header of every page (e.g., META tags).
Name of press, contacts, sponsors, and search engines.
Press Manager registers all users, with Editors or Section Editors able to register Reviewers alone.
Useful when press crosses disciplinary boundaries and/or authors submit multidisciplinary items.
(E.g., History; Education; Sociology; Psychology; Cultural Studies; Law)
Provide examples of relevant academic disciplines for this press
Add the table of contents for the current monograph (if available).
The DOI (Digital Object Identifier) Prefix is assigned by CrossRef and is in the format 10.xxxx (e.g. 10.1234).
Go to Board Members and add Editorial Board and/or Review Board members. This can be done at any point in operating the press.
One or more editors handle the basic steps without designated roles.
Managing Editor handles Submission Queue, and Table of Contents, while Section Editors handle Submission Review and Submission Editing.
Managing Editor handles Submission Queue, Submission Editing, and Table of Contents, while the Section Editors handle Submission Review.

Presses have Editorial Boards to oversee the editorial direction of the press, participate in the appointment of editors, and, by virtue of board members' reputations, give the press some standing in the field. Review Boards play a similar role but in addition, they lead the peer review process. Review Board members will not have access to the press's administrative system but will be added to the list of those available to do peer reviews.
Any undeliverable emails will result in an error message to this address.

Note: To activate this option, the site administrator must enable the allow_envelope_sender option in the OMP configuration file. Additional server configuration may be required to support this functionality (which may not be possible on all servers), as indicated in the OMP documentation.

The prepared emails that are sent by the system on behalf of the press will have the following signature added to the end. The body of the prepared emails are available for editing under Press Management.
Enable Press Managers to add press announcements.
of the most recent announcements on the press homepage.
Page numbers for items will be calculated and entered manually in the Table of Contents (e.g., pp. 13-26).
Enable this press to appear publicly on the site
Custom identifiers will be used to identify published items.
Custom identifiers will be used to identify galleys (e.g. HTML or PDF files) for published items.
Users can register themselves with the press in one or more of the following roles:
Authors (can submit materials to the press)
Readers (will receive notifications and be counted as equivalent to a subscriber)
Enter a statement below, which will appear in About the Press, that speaks to authors, readers, and librarians about the range of monographs and other items which the press will publish.
For Authors to Index Their Work

OMP adheres to the Open Archives Initiative Protocol for Metadata Harvesting, which is the emerging standard for providing well-indexed access to electronic research resources on a global scale. The authors will use a similar template to provide metadata for their submission. The Press Manager should select the categories for indexing and present authors with relevant examples to assist them in indexing their work, separating terms with a semi-colon (e.g., term1; term2). The entries should be introduced as examples by using "E.g.," or "For example,".
The primary contact email is required.
The primary contact name is required.
The number of reviewers per submission is required.
Add an image or graphic file to the middle of the page.
For presses that offer immediate or delayed open access, include a Creative Commons license with all published work at the appropriate time.
Brief descriptions of the press for librarians and prospective authors and readers are available in the "Information" section of the sidebar.
Navigation bar items can be added to the current set (Home, About, User Home, etc.) that appear at the top of the page.

Layout Instructions can be prepared for the formatting of publishing items in the press and be entered below in HTML or plain text. They will be made available to the Layout Editor and Section Editor on the Editing page of each submission. (As each press may employ its own file formats, bibliographic standards, style sheets, etc., a default set of instructions is not provided.)

Templates can be uploaded to appear in Layout for each of the standard formats published in the press (e.g., monograph, book review, etc.) using any file format (e.g., pdf, doc, etc.) with annotations added specifying font, size, margins, etc. to serve as a guide for Layout Editors and Proofreaders.
Enter the maximum number of items (for example, submissions, users, or editing assignments) that appear on each page of a list, and the number of pages links to display on each page.
Homepage header, content, press header, footer, navigation bar, and style sheet.
The press's physical location and mailing address.
Access and security, scheduling, announcements, copyediting, layout, and proofreading.
Add or remove additional navigation bar items.
URL is an absolute URL (e.g., "http://www.example.com") rather than a path relative to the site (e.g., "/manager/setup")
The label value is a literal string (e.g., "Press Setup") rather than a localization message key (e.g., "manager.setup")
Send a copy to the press's primary contact, identified in Setup Step 1.
Send a copy to this email address:

On completing the submission process, authors are automatically sent an acknowledgement email (which can be viewed and edited in Prepared Emails). In addition, a copy of the acknowledgement email can be sent as follows:
Note: The submission acknowledgement email is currently disabled. To use this feature, enable the SUBMISSION_ACK email in Prepared Emails.
When using the Notify Author email, include the email addresses of all co-authors for multiple-author submissions, and not just the submitting user.
Copyediting will be undertaken by an Editor or Section Editor assigned to the submission.
An Editor or Section Editor assigned to the submission will prepare the HTML, PDF, etc., files.
An Editor or Section Editor assigned to the submission will check the galleys.
The press will provide open access to its contents.
If the press will provide readers with immediate free access to all published content, enter an Open Access Policy which will appear in About the Press under Policies.

Outline the press's peer review policy and processes for readers and authors, including the number of reviewers typically used in reviewing a submission, the criteria by which reviewers are asked to judge submissions, typical time taken to conduct the reviews, and the principles for recruiting reviewers. This will appear in About the Press.
Focus, peer review, sections, privacy, security, and additional about items.
Add a brief 20-25 word description in text/HTML which will appear just below the navigation links.

By default, the homepage consists of navigation links. Additional homepage content can be appended by using one or all of the following options, which will appear in the order shown. Note that the newest monograph is always accessible through the Current link in the navigation bar.
A graphic version of the press's title and logo (as a .gif, .jpg, or .png file) can be uploaded for the homepage, which will replace the text version that otherwise appears.

Choose a press theme and select layout components here. A press stylesheet may also be uploaded, which can be used to override style data in the system-wide stylesheets and theme stylesheet (if a theme is chosen).

This is the footer of your press. To change or update the footer, paste the HTML code in the textbox below. Examples could be another navigation bar, a counter, etc. This footer will appear on every page.

A graphic version of the press's title and logo (.gif, .jpg, or .png file), possibly a smaller version of the one used on the homepage, can be uploaded to appear as a header on press pages, which will replace the text version that otherwise appears.
Your press setup has been updated.
Invalid press stylesheet format. Accepted format is .css.

This position, which can be treated as a principal editorship, managing editorship, or administrative staff position, will be listed on the homepage of the press under Contact, along with the Technical Support Contact.
This statement will appear in About the Press, as well as on the Author Submission and Notification sign-up pages. Below is a recommended privacy policy, which can be revised at any point.

The Proofreading Instructions will be made available to Proofreaders, Authors, Layout Editors, and Section Editors in the Submission Editing stage. Below is a default set of instructions in HTML, which can be edited or replaced by the Press Manager at any point (in HTML or plain text).

Press items can be published collectively, as part of a monograph with its own Table of Contents. Alternatively, individual items can be published as soon as they are ready, by adding them to the "current" volume's Table of Contents. Provide readers, in About the Press, with a statement about the system this press will use and its expected frequency of publication.
The name of the organization publishing the press will appear in About the Press.
Users must be registered and log in to view open access content.
Users must be registered and log in to view the press site.

The Review Guidelines will provide reviewers with criteria for judging a submission's suitability for publication in the press, and can include any special instructions for preparing an effective and helpful review. In conducting the review, reviewers are presented with with two open text boxes, the first "for author and editor," and the second "for editor." Alternatively, the Press Manager can create a peer review form under Review Forms. In all cases, editors will have the option of including the reviews in corresponding with the author.
Automated email reminders (available in OMP's default Emails) can be sent to reviewers at two points (while the editor can always email the reviewer directly as well)

Note: To activate these options, the site administrator must enable the scheduled_tasks option in the OMP configuration file. Additional server configuration may be required to support this functionality (which may not be possible on all servers), as indicated in the OMP documentation.
Can be modified during the editorial process.
The typical period of time allowed for reviews
The typical period of time allowed for reviewers to respond to a review request
Editors will rate reviewers on a five-point quality scale after each review.
If reviewer has not responded to a review request within
If reviewer has not submitted a recommendation within
Reviewers will have access to the submission file only after agreeing to review it.

Note: The email invitation to reviewers will contain a special URL that takes invited reviewers directly to the Review page for the submission (with access to any other pages requiring them to log in). For security reasons with this option, editors are not able to modify email addresses or add CCs or BCCs prior to sending invitations to reviewers.
Provide links to Ensuring a Blind Review on pages where authors and reviewers upload files.

OMP supports two models for managing the review process. The Standard Review Process is recommended because it steps reviewers through the process, ensures a complete review history for each submission, and takes advantage of automatic reminder notification, and standard recommendations for submissions (Accept; Accept with revisions; Submit for review; Submit elsewhere; Decline; See comments).

Select one of the following:

Editors will email selected Reviewers the title and abstract of the submission, as well as an invitation to log into the press web site to complete the review. Reviewers enter the press web site to agree to do the review, to download submissions, submit their comments, and select a recommendation.
To assist the users of search engines in discovering this press, provide a brief description of the press and relevant keywords (separated by semicolons).
(If sections are not added, then items are submitted to the Monographs section by default.)

To create or modify sections for the press (e.g., Monographs, Book Reviews, etc.), go to Section Management.

Authors on submitting items to the press will designate...
OMP provides a number of security-related options that can be used to restrict the press's contents, and maintain additional information about submissions for auditing purposes.
The press editor who will see it through the editorial process.
The press section for which the item will be considered.
Always show galley links and indicate restricted access.
Additional Site and Content Access Restrictions

The name of the organizations (e.g., scholarly associations, university departments, cooperatives, etc.) sponsoring the press will appear in About the Press and may be accompanied by a note of acknowledgement.
Five Steps to a Press Web Site
(E.g., Mathematics Subject Classification; Library of Congress Classification)
(E.g., Photosynthesis; Black Holes; Four-Color Map Problem; Bayesian Theory)
Provide examples of keywords or topics as a guide for authors

On making a submission to the press, authors are first asked to check each item on the Submission Preparation Checklist as completed, before proceeding. The checklist also appears in the Author Guidelines, under About the Press. The list can be edited below, but all items on the list will require a checkmark before authors can proceed with their submission.
Author guidelines, copyright, and indexing (including registration).

This person will be listed on the press's Contact page for the use of editors, authors, and reviewers, and should have experience working through the system from the perspective of all of its roles. As this press system requires very little technical support, this should be seen as a part-time assignment. There may be occasions, for example, when authors and reviewers have difficulties with the instructions or file formats, or there's a need to ensure that the press is regularly backed up on the server.
(E.g., Historical Inquiry; Quasi-Experimental; Literary Analysis; Survey/Interview)
Provide examples of relevant research types, methods, and approaches for this field
Monographs can be tagged with an identification number or string, employing a registration system such as the Digital Object Identifier System (DOI).
A Copyeditor will be assigned to work with each submission.
An editorial/review board will be used by the press.
A Layout Editor will be assigned to prepare the HTML, PDF, etc., files for electronic publication.
A Proofreader will be assigned to check (along with the authors) the galleys prior to publication.
To create a new publication format, fill out the form below and click the 'Create' button.

These genres are used for file-naming purposes and are presented in a pull-down menu on uploading files. The genres designated ## allow the user to associate the file with either the whole book 99Z or a particular chapter by number (e.g., 02).

Editors send Reviewers the request to review with the submission attached to the email. Reviewers email editors their assent (or regrets), as well as the review and recommendation. Editors enter Reviewers' assent (or regrets), as well as the review and recommendation on the submission's Review page, to record the review process.
To create a new genre, fill out the form below and click the 'Create' button.
Allow files of this type to be sorted by component (e.g. by chapter)

The prospectus guide is a press prepared document that helps the author describe the submitted materials in a way that allows a press to determine the value of the submission. A prospectus can include a lot of items- from marketing potential to theoretical value; in any case, a press should create a prospectus guide that complements their publishing agenda.

The ISSN (International Standard Serial Number) is an eight-digit number which identifies periodical publications as such, including electronic serials. It is managed by a world wide network of National Centres coordinated by an International Centre based in Paris, backed by Unesco and the French Government. A number can be obtained from the ISSN web site. This can be done at any point in operating the press.
Note: The Files Browser is an advanced feature that allows the files and directories associated with a press to be viewed and manipulated directly.

Proposed Creative Commons Copyright Notices

1. Proposed Policy for Presses That Offer Open Access

Authors who publish with this press agree to the following terms:
  1. Authors retain copyright and grant the press right of first publication with the work simultaneously licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution License that allows others to share the work with an acknowledgement of the work's authorship and initial publication in this press.
  2. Authors are able to enter into separate, additional contractual series for the non-exclusive distribution of the press's published version of the work (e.g., post it to an institutional repository or publish it in a book), with an acknowledgement of its initial publication in this press.
  3. Authors are permitted and encouraged to post their work online (e.g., in institutional repositories or on their website) prior to and during the submission process, as it can lead to productive exchanges, as well as earlier and greater citation of published work (See The Effect of Open Access).

Proposed Policy for Presses That Offer Delayed Open Access

Authors who publish with this press agree to the following terms:
  1. Authors retain copyright and grant the press right of first publication, with the work [SPECIFY PERIOD OF TIME] after publication simultaneously licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution License that allows others to share the work with an acknowledgement of the work's authorship and initial publication in this press.
  2. Authors are able to enter into separate, additional contractual series for the non-exclusive distribution of the press's published version of the work (e.g., post it to an institutional repository or publish it in a book), with an acknowledgement of its initial publication in this press.
  3. Authors are permitted and encouraged to post their work online (e.g., in institutional repositories or on their website) prior to and during the submission process, as it can lead to productive exchanges, as well as earlier and greater citation of published work (See The Effect of Open Access).

[Press will use a subject classification system available on the web.
Title of classification system

To have the contents of this press indexed within a globally distributed system of research databases, register your press's URL with the Public Knowledge Project metadata harvester. This tool collects the metadata from each indexed item in this press, enabling accurate and collective searching among the research sites that adhere to the Open Archives Initiative Protocol for Metadata Harvesting.

Note that if your site administrator has already registered this site with the PKP Harvester, your press will be indexed automatically and you do not need to register your press.

Click here and enter {$siteUrl} under Site URL, and {$oaiUrl} under Base URL for OAI Archive.

Steps: Submission Queue > Submission Review > Submission Editing > Table of Contents.

Select a model for handling these aspects of the editorial process. (To designate a Managing Editor and Series Editors, go to Editors in Press Management.)

To enable readers to locate online versions of the work cited by an author, the following options are available.

  1. Add a Reading Tool

    The Press Manager can add "Find References" to the Reading Tools that accompany published items, which enables readers to paste a reference's title and then search pre-selected scholarly databases for the cited work.

  2. Embed Links in the References

    The Layout Editor can add a link to references that can be found online by using the following instructions (which can be edited).

To have the contents of this press indexed within a globally distributed system of research databases, register your press's URL with the Public Knowledge Project metadata harvester. This tool collects the metadata from each indexed item in this press, enabling accurate and collective searching among the research sites that adhere to the Open Archives Initiative Protocol for Metadata Harvesting.

Note that if your site administrator has already registered this site with the PKP Harvester, your press will be indexed automatically and you do not need to register your press.

Click here and enter {$siteUrl} under Site URL, and {$oaiUrl} under Base URL for OAI Archive.

OMP generates reports that track the details associated with processing submissions to the press from the perspective of submissions, editors, reviewers, and sections, over a given period of time. Reports are generated in CSV format which requires a spreadsheet application to view.

OMP calculates the following statistics for each press. The "days to review" is calculated from date of submission (or designation of Review Version) to the initial Editor Decision, while the "days to publish" is measured for accepted submissions from its original uploading to its publication.
Check items to be made available to readers in About the Press.
Note: Percentages for peer reviewed submissions may not add up to 100%, as items resubmitted are either accepted, declined, or still in process.
Select the sections for calculating this press's peer-reviewed statistics.
